intro: Urananthus russelianus, commonly known as the pink fairy fanflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers that resemble small fans. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
